content: अध्यापकः [अधि-इ-णिच्-ण्वुल्] A teacher, preceptor, instructor; especially of the Vedas; व्याकरण°, न्याय° professor or teacher of grammar, logic &c.; भृतक° a hired teacher, mercenary teacher; °उदितः styled a professor. According to <ls>Viṣṇu Smṛti</ls> an {%adhyāpaka%} is of {2} kinds: he is either an {%Ācārya%} <ab>i. e.</ab> one who invests a boy with the sacred thread and initiates him into the Vedas, or he is an {%Upādhyāya%} <ab>i. e.</ab> one who teaches for livelihood (वृत्त्यर्थं) See <ls>Ms. 2. 140-141</ls> and the two words.
